I did not implement a fully symmetric comparison, to avoid potential issues if a custom fully-qualified class given to the REST endpoint matches a regular simple class name given in `connector.class` property. 

What's supported is: 

- ✅ Simple name in REST matches simple name in property. 
- ✅ Simple name in REST matches canonical name in property. 
- ✖️ Canonical name in REST does not match simple name in property. 
- ✅ Canonical name in REST matches canonical name in property. 

Also, seems to me that the wrong Exception was thrown to return a bad request, but we should double-check that this is the case.

LGTM. Note that this doesn't need to go to 0.10.2 (correct me if I'm wrong @mjsax )
Yeah, let me have a look.

@mjsax @enothereska i think doing small cleanups a long the way is the appropriate thing to do. Having separate PRs just for minor cleanups that can be done with another PR is a bit silly. Refactoring should be a constant effort. The trick is choosing to not go too far, which admittedly can be difficult at times.

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.11/2681/
Test PASSed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.11).
LGTM

@mjsax @dguy I'm not suggesting separate PRs, just separate commits as part of the same PR. So in the PR we can see the commit history (fix, followed by cleanup, or vice versa). Right now for every 10 line fix there are another 100 lines of cleanup making it hard to see the exact fix. Changing 39 files for a fix like this makes reviewing hard and unnecessarily long. Again, not separate PRs, just a bit more care with commit order.
@dguy alright :) `final` added :)
@enothereska oh - fair enough.
